column1: Narrator : There’s no beach on this island. From the shallow water rises a small forest.

column2: Narrator : The captain wakes up on the beach. The morning air is pure and fresh.

column1: Narrator : Under the bright sun, birds are singing and the branches sway gently to a soft breeze.
column2: Narrator : The only sounds breaking the silence in the dark woods are some rustling branches and owls hooting faintly.

column1: Narrator : A bit further, a huge stone door is embedded in an immense rock. It’s surrounded by scriptures and engravings.

column3: PlayerSpeak : It's locked, and it doesn't look like it's going to budge anytime soon.
column4: Narrator : The stone door opens surprisingly smoothly for its size. It reveals a staircase, going down. You can’t see the bottom.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE hears a soft «click» from the door.
column3: Narrator : Engraved in the stone is the silhouette of a snake, dancing out of a basket.
column5: Narrator : Access is granted to innocent souls, and their soft companions.
column7: PlayerSpeak : It looks like stars, and the moon.
column9: Narrator : « I am an instrument of death for the scaly, the silvery and the glossy, but an instrument of leisure for the father and his son » can be read above a small recess in the stone.
column11: Narrator : The engravings read : « People poke me full of needles but I won't be the one suffering from it » above a small hole.
column13: Narrator : The engravings read : « I grow in the darkness of the sea but shine brightly into the light ». Right underneath them is a small round recess.
column15: Narrator : As CAPITAINE gets closer to read the engravings, the rock rumbles and sinks down in the earth, revealing a large hole.
column19: Narrator : The engravings read : « My flame is not eternal, seal your letters before I got out »

column17: PlayerSpeak : It’s way deeper than I thought...

column16: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have any rope…

column15: Narrator : After what feels like an eternity, CAPITAINE reaches the bottom of the hole.

column1: Narrator : In the darkness of the cave, a treasure chest shines brightly from further away.

column3: Narrator : Further away, a century old skeleton is sat beneath the wall. The adventurer clearly was trapped here until his death.
Narrator : He apparently was going mad with hunger, thirst or loneliness, as the wall he is sat on is riddled with knife made markings.

column4: Narrator : Although they all seem to refer to the same thing, it is very hard to read them.
Narrator : After thorough observation, CAPITAINE picks out every letter and puts them together.
Narrator : They form the word : « FORMULA »

column2: PlayerSpeak : I’ve taken all the gold.

column1: PlayerSpeak : That’s a lot of money!
